02-01-05 Si√™u ph·∫≥ng

Si√™u ph·∫≥ng l√† m·ªôt trong nh·ªØng ƒë·ªëi t∆∞·ª£ng h√¨nh h·ªçc c∆° b·∫£n nh·∫•t trong t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a l·ªìi v√† ƒë·∫°i s·ªë tuy·∫øn t√≠nh. N√≥ ƒë√≥ng vai tr√≤ nh∆∞ m·ªôt kh·ªëi x√¢y d·ª±ng ƒë·ªÉ hi·ªÉu c√°c t·∫≠p l·ªìi ph·ª©c t·∫°p h∆°n v√† ƒë√≥ng vai tr√≤ quan tr·ªçng trong c√°c thu·∫≠t to√°n t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a, machine learning v√† ph√¢n t√≠ch h√¨nh h·ªçc.

ƒê·ªãnh nghƒ©a Si√™u ph·∫≥ng

M·ªôt si√™u ph·∫≥ng trong \(\mathbb{R}^n\) l√† m·ªôt t·∫≠p h·ª£p c√≥ d·∫°ng:

\[\mathcal{H} = \{x \in \mathbb{R}^n : a^T x = b\}\]

trong ƒë√≥ \(a \in \mathbb{R}^n\) l√† m·ªôt vector kh√°c kh√¥ng (\(a \neq 0\)) v√† \(b \in \mathbb{R}\) l√† m·ªôt s·ªë v√¥ h∆∞·ªõng.

Vector \(a\) ƒë∆∞·ª£c g·ªçi l√† vector ph√°p tuy·∫øn c·ªßa si√™u ph·∫≥ng, v√† n√≥ x√°c ƒë·ªãnh h∆∞·ªõng c·ªßa si√™u ph·∫≥ng. S·ªë v√¥ h∆∞·ªõng \(b\) x√°c ƒë·ªãnh v·ªã tr√≠ c·ªßa si√™u ph·∫≥ng so v·ªõi g·ªëc t·ªça ƒë·ªô.

Gi·∫£i th√≠ch H√¨nh h·ªçc

  • Trong \(\mathbb{R}^2\): M·ªôt si√™u ph·∫≥ng l√† m·ªôt ƒë∆∞·ªùng th·∫≥ng
  • Trong \(\mathbb{R}^3\): M·ªôt si√™u ph·∫≥ng l√† m·ªôt m·∫∑t ph·∫≥ng
  • Trong \(\mathbb{R}^n\) (\(n > 3\)): M·ªôt si√™u ph·∫≥ng l√† m·ªôt kh√¥ng gian con \((n-1)\) chi·ªÅu

Si√™u ph·∫≥ng chia to√†n b·ªô kh√¥ng gian \(\mathbb{R}^n\) th√†nh hai n·ª≠a kh√¥ng gian:

  • N·ª≠a kh√¥ng gian d∆∞∆°ng: \(\{x : a^T x \geq b\}\)
  • N·ª≠a kh√¥ng gian √¢m: \(\{x : a^T x \leq b\}\)

T√≠nh ch·∫•t c·ªßa Si√™u ph·∫≥ng

1. T√≠nh ch·∫•t T·∫≠p Affine

M·ªçi si√™u ph·∫≥ng ƒë·ªÅu l√† t·∫≠p affine. ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y c√≥ nghƒ©a l√† n·∫øu \(x_1, x_2 \in \mathcal{H}\), th√¨ to√†n b·ªô ƒë∆∞·ªùng th·∫≥ng ƒëi qua ch√∫ng c≈©ng ƒë∆∞·ª£c ch·ª©a trong \(\mathcal{H}\):

\[\theta x_1 + (1-\theta) x_2 \in \mathcal{H} \quad \forall \theta \in \mathbb{R}\]

Ch·ª©ng minh: N·∫øu \(a^T x_1 = b\) v√† \(a^T x_2 = b\), th√¨: \(a^T(\theta x_1 + (1-\theta) x_2) = \theta a^T x_1 + (1-\theta) a^T x_2 = \theta b + (1-\theta) b = b\)

2. T√≠nh ch·∫•t T·∫≠p L·ªìi

V√¨ m·ªçi t·∫≠p affine ƒë·ªÅu l√† l·ªìi, si√™u ph·∫≥ng l√† t·∫≠p l·ªìi. V·ªõi b·∫•t k·ª≥ \(x_1, x_2 \in \mathcal{H}\) v√† \(\lambda \in [0,1]\):

\[\lambda x_1 + (1-\lambda) x_2 \in \mathcal{H}\]

3. T√≠nh ch·∫•t T·∫≠p ƒê√≥ng

Si√™u ph·∫≥ng l√† t·∫≠p ƒë√≥ng v√¨ ch√∫ng l√† t·∫≠p m·ª©c c·ªßa c√°c h√†m tuy·∫øn t√≠nh li√™n t·ª•c.

4. Chi·ªÅu

M·ªôt si√™u ph·∫≥ng trong \(\mathbb{R}^n\) c√≥ chi·ªÅu \(n-1\).

C√°c c√°ch bi·ªÉu di·ªÖn kh√°c

1. D·∫°ng ƒêi·ªÉm-Ph√°p tuy·∫øn

N·∫øu ch√∫ng ta bi·∫øt m·ªôt ƒëi·ªÉm \(x_0\) tr√™n si√™u ph·∫≥ng v√† vector ph√°p tuy·∫øn \(a\), si√™u ph·∫≥ng c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë∆∞·ª£c vi·∫øt nh∆∞:

\[\mathcal{H} = \{x : a^T (x - x_0) = 0\}\]

ƒêi·ªÅu n√†y t∆∞∆°ng ƒë∆∞∆°ng v·ªõi \(a^T x = a^T x_0\), v·∫≠y \(b = a^T x_0\).

2. D·∫°ng Ma tr·∫≠n

M·ªôt si√™u ph·∫≥ng c≈©ng c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë∆∞·ª£c bi·ªÉu di·ªÖn b·∫±ng k√Ω hi·ªáu ma tr·∫≠n. N·∫øu \(A\) l√† ma tr·∫≠n \(1 \times n\) (vector h√†ng), th√¨:

\[\mathcal{H} = \{x : Ax = b\}\]

3. D·∫°ng Tham s·ªë

M·ªôt si√™u ph·∫≥ng c√≥ th·ªÉ ƒë∆∞·ª£c tham s·ªë h√≥a b·∫±ng c√°ch s·ª≠ d·ª•ng m·ªôt c∆° s·ªü cho kh√¥ng gian null c·ªßa n√≥. N·∫øu \(\{v_1, v_2, \ldots, v_{n-1}\}\) l√† m·ªôt c∆° s·ªü tr·ª±c chu·∫©n cho kh√¥ng gian null c·ªßa \(a^T\), v√† \(x_0\) l√† b·∫•t k·ª≥ ƒëi·ªÉm n√†o tr√™n si√™u ph·∫≥ng, th√¨:

\[\mathcal{H} = \{x_0 + t_1 v_1 + t_2 v_2 + \cdots + t_{n-1} v_{n-1} : t_i \in \mathbb{R}\}\]

Kho·∫£ng c√°ch t·ª´ ƒêi·ªÉm ƒë·∫øn Si√™u ph·∫≥ng

Kho·∫£ng c√°ch t·ª´ m·ªôt ƒëi·ªÉm \(x_0\) ƒë·∫øn si√™u ph·∫≥ng \(\{x : a^T x = b\}\) ƒë∆∞·ª£c cho b·ªüi:

\[d(x_0, \mathcal{H}) = \frac{\lvert a^T x_0 - b \rvert}{\lVert a \rVert_2}\]

C√¥ng th·ª©c n√†y xu·∫•t ph√°t t·ª´ vi·ªác chi·∫øu vector t·ª´ b·∫•t k·ª≥ ƒëi·ªÉm n√†o tr√™n si√™u ph·∫≥ng ƒë·∫øn \(x_0\) l√™n h∆∞·ªõng ph√°p tuy·∫øn.

Suy d·∫´n

G·ªçi \(x^*\) l√† ƒëi·ªÉm g·∫ßn nh·∫•t tr√™n si√™u ph·∫≥ng v·ªõi \(x_0\). Th√¨ \(x^* - x_0\) song song v·ªõi vector ph√°p tuy·∫øn \(a\):

\[x^* - x_0 = t \frac{a}{\lVert a \rVert_2}\]

V√¨ \(x^* \in \mathcal{H}\), ta c√≥ \(a^T x^* = b\). Thay th·∫ø:

\[a^T \left(x_0 + t \frac{a}{\lVert a \rVert_2}\right) = b\]

Gi·∫£i t√¨m \(t\): \(t = \frac{b - a^T x_0}{\lVert a \rVert_2}\)

Kho·∫£ng c√°ch l√† \(\lvert t \rvert = \frac{\lvert a^T x_0 - b \rvert}{\lVert a \rVert_2}\).

V√≠ d·ª•

V√≠ d·ª• 1: ƒê∆∞·ªùng th·∫≥ng trong \(\mathbb{R}^2\)

Si√™u ph·∫≥ng \(2x_1 + 3x_2 = 6\) bi·ªÉu di·ªÖn m·ªôt ƒë∆∞·ªùng th·∫≥ng trong m·∫∑t ph·∫≥ng.

  • Vector ph√°p tuy·∫øn: \(a = (2, 3)\)
  • ƒê∆∞·ªùng th·∫≥ng ƒëi qua c√°c ƒëi·ªÉm \((3, 0)\) v√† \((0, 2)\)
  • Kho·∫£ng c√°ch t·ª´ g·ªëc t·ªça ƒë·ªô: \(\frac{\lvert 2 \cdot 0 + 3 \cdot 0 - 6 \rvert}{\sqrt{2^2 + 3^2}} = \frac{6}{\sqrt{13}}\)

V√≠ d·ª• 2: M·∫∑t ph·∫≥ng trong \(\mathbb{R}^3\)

Si√™u ph·∫≥ng \(x_1 - 2x_2 + x_3 = 4\) bi·ªÉu di·ªÖn m·ªôt m·∫∑t ph·∫≥ng trong kh√¥ng gian 3D.

  • Vector ph√°p tuy·∫øn: \(a = (1, -2, 1)\)
  • M·∫∑t ph·∫≥ng ƒëi qua c√°c ƒëi·ªÉm \((4, 0, 0)\), \((0, -2, 0)\), v√† \((0, 0, 4)\)

V√≠ d·ª• 3: Si√™u ph·∫≥ng ƒëi qua G·ªëc t·ªça ƒë·ªô

Si√™u ph·∫≥ng \(a^T x = 0\) lu√¥n ƒëi qua g·ªëc t·ªça ƒë·ªô v√† th·ª±c s·ª± l√† m·ªôt kh√¥ng gian con c√≥ chi·ªÅu \(n-1\).

Tr·ª±c quan h√≥a T∆∞∆°ng t√°c

[Ghi ch√∫: Ph·∫ßn n√†y ch·ª©a m√£ JavaScript ƒë·ªÉ t·∫°o tr·ª±c quan h√≥a t∆∞∆°ng t√°c v·ªÅ si√™u ph·∫≥ng. Ph·∫ßn n√†y s·∫Ω ƒë∆∞·ª£c d·ªãch ri√™ng do t√≠nh ph·ª©c t·∫°p c·ªßa m√£.]

M·ªëi quan h·ªá v·ªõi c√°c Kh√°i ni·ªám kh√°c

K·∫øt n·ªëi v·ªõi T·∫≠p Affine

M·ªçi si√™u ph·∫≥ng ƒë·ªÅu l√† t·∫≠p affine, nh∆∞ng kh√¥ng ph·∫£i m·ªçi t·∫≠p affine ƒë·ªÅu l√† si√™u ph·∫≥ng. Si√™u ph·∫≥ng l√† c√°c t·∫≠p affine c√≥ chi·ªÅu \((n-1)\) c·ª• th·ªÉ trong \(\mathbb{R}^n\).

K·∫øt n·ªëi v·ªõi ƒê·∫°i s·ªë Tuy·∫øn t√≠nh

Si√™u ph·∫≥ng \(\{x : a^T x = b\}\) l√† t·∫≠p m·ª©c c·ªßa h√†m tuy·∫øn t√≠nh \(f(x) = a^T x\) t·∫°i m·ª©c \(b\). Gradient c·ªßa h√†m n√†y l√† h·∫±ng s·ªë v√† b·∫±ng \(a\), ƒëi·ªÅu n√†y gi·∫£i th√≠ch t·∫°i sao \(a\) vu√¥ng g√≥c v·ªõi si√™u ph·∫≥ng.

K·∫øt n·ªëi v·ªõi T·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a

Trong t·ªëi ∆∞u h√≥a c√≥ r√†ng bu·ªôc, c√°c r√†ng bu·ªôc ƒë·∫≥ng th·ª©c th∆∞·ªùng ƒë·ªãnh nghƒ©a c√°c si√™u ph·∫≥ng h·∫°n ch·∫ø mi·ªÅn kh·∫£ thi. Ph∆∞∆°ng ph√°p nh√¢n t·ª≠ Lagrange khai th√°c th·ª±c t·∫ø r·∫±ng t·∫°i ƒëi·ªÉm t·ªëi ∆∞u, gradient c·ªßa h√†m m·ª•c ti√™u song song v·ªõi vector ph√°p tuy·∫øn c·ªßa si√™u ph·∫≥ng r√†ng bu·ªôc.

Interactive Visualization

Hyperplane equation: x‚ÇÅ + x‚ÇÇ = 0

Distance from origin: 0.0

Relationship to Other Concepts

Connection to Affine Sets

Every hyperplane is an affine set, but not every affine set is a hyperplane. Hyperplanes are specifically \((n-1)\)-dimensional affine sets in \(\mathbb{R}^n\).

Connection to Linear Algebra

The hyperplane \(\{x : a^T x = b\}\) is the level set of the linear function \(f(x) = a^T x\) at level \(b\). The gradient of this function is constant and equal to \(a\), which explains why \(a\) is perpendicular to the hyperplane.

Connection to Optimization

In constrained optimization, equality constraints often define hyperplanes that restrict the feasible region. The method of Lagrange multipliers exploits the fact that at an optimal point, the gradient of the objective function is parallel to the normal vector of the constraint hyperplane.
